p: Fibrosis involves excess extracellular matrix (ECM), such as collagen and fibronectin, and this production is initiated by the activation of hepatocellular stellate cells into myofibroblasts in the process of repairing damaged hepatocytes. Fibrosis can result in reduced liver function, hepatocyte necrosis, decreased intrahepatic microcirculation, and even cirrhosis or cancer [ 64]. However, because fibrosis can be reversed unlike liver cirrhosis, active management of liver fibrosis is required.
